edu.southalabama.csc527.smallworld.textui

Class WordWrappedMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.southalabama.csc527.smallworld.textui.WordWrappedMessage

  • public final class WordWrappedMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that produces word wrapped string messages. The message starts empty and has sentences appended to it. These sentences are word wrapped to a desired text width. The default text width is 50.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String LINESEP
      A String holding the operating system specific line separator obtained from the system properties.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      WordWrappedMessage()

      Appends a blank line at the end of the current message.
      void clear()
      Clears this message.
      void replaceContents(WordWrappedMessage message)

      Sets the desired text width of lines.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WordWrappedMessage

        public WordWrappedMessage()

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String s)
        Appends the given string to this message. The string is word wrapped.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to append to this message.

      • appendBlankLine

        public void appendBlankLine()
        Appends a blank line at the end of the current message. Useful for creating a new paragraph of information in the message output.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this message.

      • replaceContents

        public void replaceContents(WordWrappedMessage message)
        Makes this word wrapped message a copy of the specified word wrapped message. Both the contents and the desired text width are copied.
        Parameters:
        message - the word wrapped message to copy

      • setDesiredTextWidth

        public void setDesiredTextWidth(int textWidth)
        Sets the desired text width of lines. Specifies the column at which we word wrap the text appended into this message.
        Parameters:
        textWidth - the desired width of lines in this message.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
